values:
Last night, in a dream, a woman mixed me a drink she called a Calvin and Hobbes.  It was rum and Coke, she told me, but with a float of Cointreau.  The drink made me happy in the dream, so when I went over to Dad's this afternoon I decided to try replicating it.  It was good---somewhat sweet and pleasantly orangey---and I imagine it would be just charming garnished with a tiger tail of orange peel.

You wanna make one?  Of course you do:

Step 1: Get ye highball glass.  Fill halfway with ice.

Step 2: Get ye rum.  Light, dark...Mysterious Anima Figure did not specify, so it's up to you. (For the record, I used Bacardi Gold, as it's what was on hand.)

Step 3: Measure one shot of rum and pour over ice.  Or more.  I won't judge you.

Step 4: Fill glass the rest of the way with Coke.   Mmm, fizzy.

Step 5: Float some Cointreau on top, or, failing that (it *is* pricey), whatever you've got that's orangey.  For example, Dad had no Cointreau, but did have some Sublime orange liqueur and some Blue Curacao.  After much deliberation, sans internet access for researching---God, but I'm useless without teh Google---I decided on the former, then bitched out and put a splash of the latter, because I'm indecisive.

Step 6: Drink up, and forget your problems at home.


WARNING:  Excessive consumption of this drink may result in dangerous philosophical toboggan rides.
Dumpus fell asleep in her stroller on our walk yesterday. She woke up with panda prints in her mooshy little face.
